record.dc:title: 125BY13 Ledford Island, Bradley County, Tennessee. From right to left: 16BY26, middle, flexed; 16BY20, fragmentary extended burial above 16BY26; 16BY32, extended burial in center, stones over torso; 16BY33, extended burial left center; 16BY35, extended burial in left foreground; 16BY36, torso and skull of child in left foreground. Square 2R14. Direction South.
record.wpa:narrative: [16BY20] Indeterminate male in poor condition, extended on back with head to SW. Pit outline included 16BY26, 32, and 33. No individual outlines for each pit apparent. Skeleton almost entirely removed by plow. [16BY26] Mature male in good condition, fully flexed on right side with head to NE. Fill of pit was humus mottled with clay and a small quantity of diffuse ash. Apparently pit was dug before and separately from the upper pit containing 16BY20, 32, and 33. 0.9' of mottled pit fill between burials 20 and 26. [16BY32] Indeterminate juvenile in fair condition, extended on back with head to SW. Broken boulder over chest, another between femora, and a smaller one to left of left femur. Right radius and foot bones scattered for 1.0' northeast of ankles. Mandible shifted downward toward chest. Skull tilted back on lambda. [16BY33] Senile female in fair condition, extended on back with head to SW. Lower legs extended under torso of 16BY32. Fill of pit mottled humus and clay. About 0.3' intervening fill of pit between 32 and 33. [16BY35] Adult female in good condition, extended on back with head to NW. Pit filled with mottled humus and clay. Body apparently crammed against south wall of pit. [16BY36] Indeterminate infant in fair condition, extended on back with head to SW. Apparently partially removed by plow--remaining bones slightly shifted. Pit filled with mottled clay and humus--indistinct and very shallow.
